column2: A beautiful place to visit even without children! It was a pleasure to see and stroke the kangaroos. They are delightful. There are also other birds and animals but of course the kangaroos are the stars! Highly recommended.

This guest house is situated in a beautiful area. The rooms are well designed with a jacuzzi. Unfortunately, there was no instructions how to work it so we didn't use it.
The breakfast is good with a lovely view of the lake and it was a pleasure to sit there.

After being closed for a long time becauseof Covid, we chose this restaurant having known them for more than 30 years. We ordered the Thai ( see photos) which was excellent. Service was wonderful . Thanks to Rina the owner. We will definitely return. Highly recommended.

We were back again after having our stay cancelled due to the Corona virus. Everything was perfect: the rooms were clean, the food was excellent. The spa pool was also open for a limited amount of people which was wonderful. Sigalit, the Public Relations Manageress was very helpful and is a credit to Isrotel. Thank you so much. Also thank you to Lamlamu for helping us with parking near the hotel. We will, of course, be returning soon!

We have been many times and enjoyed the food and service. I ordered a Pad Thai which was excellent
The portion was so big that I took half the portion home with me. My husband ate grilled chicken and was very satisfied. Recommended.

We arrived today at this restaurant and fortunately they followed all the rules relating to the Corona Virus. We sat outside and had an amazing view. The food was excellent. We started with Taramasalata. The main courses were grilled Bass and Denis fish cooked in a piquant sauce. (Hreime). For desert we ate vegan Malabi. Everything was tasty, well cooked and prepared. Will return. Excellent service.

Situated in Israel's Golan heights, this is a beautifully designed guest house as you can see from the photos. The owner left in the room fresh cherries, wine, cakes, sweets and other treats. Inside the fridge was a jug of delicious lemonade. Will definitely return.
Due to the Coronavirus (unfortunate) the aeroplane was empty which made the flight very enjoyable. It was so comfortable.

Three of us went for a "Champagne Tea". It was very good and consisted of tasty sandwiches,cakes, scones and cream, tea and of course champagne. All were excellent including the service. Beautful view. Recommended.
We ordered a Avocado Antipasti. This was delicious, It was made from Avocado, Eggplant, Eggs, corn and other ingredients. Very good.
Very good restaurant with tasty food. I ate a vegetarian mousaka and my sister a chicken dish. We had mezze to start with delicious pitot.
We were very satisfied with the food but over ordered! The food was tasty and the service was prompt and attentive

This hotel has character a d is pleasant. The rooms are old and charming but the beds made a noise and weren't comfortable. Breakfast was ok with a vegetarian option. The location is good with parking spaces nearby.

My husband was staying at this hotel for a week in March. It is a very modern hotel in the center of the city, clean and very comfortable. The breakfast was good and was satisfactory, The staff in the hotel tried everything to help and this was appreciated. A special thanks to the reservation department who gave me the right room according to my request. Also thank you very much to Gubanek Gabor and Cratari Bence. They were always willing to help and were very polite. They are a credit to the hotel.

We had very high expectations from this restaurant but were disappointed. As someone who has visited many Indian restaurants over the years, I couldn't eat anything and returned the dish. In addition the food took one hour to arrive. Weird taste. The waiter was extremely nice and understanding.
The food was good and well prepared. I ate a Thali which was good but not exceptional. I would recommend it as an option.
We were very satisfied with the food and helpful service. We ordered a soba salad. Vegetable quiche and a Indian type of dish. All were very tasty. Will return.

I ordered stir fried with salmon and vegetables . It was tasty but a bit too salty. The sushi was good but the soup ( vegetables and noodles) was impossible to eat as it was over spiced. The service was good and helpful.
We ordered the business lunch called Tali. It was delicious. See the photo to get an idea. Worth a visit.

We have visited Isrotel Hotel Dead Sea many times. The rooms are modern well cleaned and comfortable. The staff are excellent - especially Victoria the Reception Manager. Also helpful is the guy in charge of parking and Itzhak the Restaurant manager. The food is excellent and suitable for all tastes. One complaint is the evening entertainment that is always the same. Will be back soon.
The service is good. The food is tasty and plentiful. Freshly cooked which is important. Have been many times.
We ordered the business lunch. Vegan burgers together with a side dish of lentils and quinoa. We also had a "green" drink. Everything was excellent. Recommended.
Comfortable short flight. Nice service although I didn't like the sandwich but then maybe I wasn't hungry!
The food is good but small portions. Service is excellent but we ordered hot chocolate and returned it twice as there was no taste of chocolate. Won't return.
The Acropolis is a world-leading site in Athens. It is a must for any visitor. In the night it is exceptionally beautiful. A must.

Monastiraki is a bustling area in the centre of Athens. There is a railway going to Piraeus. In the same area there is the Athens Flea market which sells good quality items. There are many shops and restaurants around. Worth a visit.

This area is worth visiting if only just for the beautiful views. You wont be able to stop taking photos. There are many places to walk but not too difficult. It is easy for most people. It costs 5 euro each to enter the Archelogical site there but it is worth it.

It is an enormous mall. There are shops from all the well know top designers. They are not cheap unfornately so it cant be called an "outlet" but maybe it appeals to some people. There are also the well know shops there like H&M, Zara, Bershka etc. The place is beautiful with lovelyl multi=coloured waterfalls.

A wonderful hotel in every way. The rooms are beautiful, the breakfast is more than excellent and the service is wonderful. The position of the hotel is also an important factor. It is in Ermou Street which the main shopping and entertainment centre in Athens. There are countless restaurants and tavernas within a few minutes away. Thank you to Cristina and Marianina in the reservations department. Also the reception staff were perfect. Thank you Georgia, Vivian and Mariana you were great and an asset to the hotel. We received an upgrade to a room with a Hammam and this was amazing. We will be back,.

We were disappointed that they didnt have fish - only Octopus!
We ordered a Greek salad together with Taramasalata and Tzadiki. The portions were generous and tasty. The waiter tried to be helpful and for people who like lamp chops, it is a good choice.

This taverna is situated not far from Athens. It is clean and well appointed
The service is very efficient with excellent food for all tastes. The music is very good as well.
We visited Avocado day after day and were very satisfied. We particularly liked the avocado penne. The restaurant is small but cosy and the service is excellent. Highly recommended.

The food was good until the fish arrived. This was undercooked and couldn't be eaten. We were offered a replacement meal but we were too full. The live music was excellent. Would still recommend this taverna.
We all ordered different meals. I took the business lunch which was well organised and varied selection in a buffet. All the food ordered was tasty and freshly cooked.
This is a very beautiful lake which also surrounds Tiberias. There are also many beaches to choose from.

The Club Hotel has a wonderful potential but it needs renovation. They are continually busy with hundreds of tourists each day. We enjoyed our stay by driving each day to beautiful sites in the area. We made the best of every day.
A few words of praise to the staff: Mondar the polite and helpful Night Manager, Meir and Moshiko as well as the Reception staff. Thank you. We will be back next year.

Nimrods fortress is situated in the Golan heights area of Northern Israel. It is historically and archeologically interesting. In addition there is a lot to see by walking around the area. There are a lot of steps to climb but it is worth it. Highly recommended.

I think the attached photos will show how interesting this reserve is. There are a few different routes to walk some difficult some easy. We also saw some wonderful eagles flying around. The choice is yours!

We ordered the business meal for couples. It consisted of cauliflower
Humus and falafel. This was followed by 3 different types of fish together with vegetables. No words can describe this other than excellent.
Very nice walking around especially if the weather is good. Nice views from a high level. Only sad point is that there isn't much greenery due a hot dry summer.

We ordered sweet and sour chicken, pad so noodles and rice. They were very tasty. In the past, chinese tea was included in the meal but it has been removed . A pity.
Why not to spoil customers a bit?

I am so upset about what is happening in Tiberius. It is run down and nobody seems to care. It has so much potential. It is basically a beautiful place. Banks and shops are closing and Tiberius needs a good clean.

The food was very good both in quality and quantity. We started off with soup, followed by a wide variety of salads. We ordered fish which was cooked well and very tasty. We also received fruit for dessert. So much food that we took some home!
This gallery has very nice products but unfortunately it is very expensive for the average person. A pity.

This is situated in a central part of Tel Aviv. It is very popular with the young crowd and is always super busy. We ordered a vegan platter which was very tasty and was more than enough for 2 people. They gave us some fruit juice which was on the house as well as some cookies. (I suppose because we came at the end of the day but it was really appreciated).Recommended
Open at the end of the week. Not much in variety but could be interesting for some people. Sometimes they have interesting antiques.
Ir Yamim mall is situated in South Netanya. It is an excellent mall with a great selection of shopping for all tastes. More important there is a lot of parking available.
The Brick Lane beigal shop is situated in East London. They sell authentic Beigels from the "old school" and they are very tasty.Delecious.
Caesarea National Park is a gem. A wonderful archeological site. It can easily be visited with young children and this is a great advantage. Dont miss this.
The Theatre at Caesarea National Park is an archeological gem. No one visiting the area should miss this. It is outstanding.
While visiting Caesarea National Park, this is a beautiful area to see. The view to the harbour is really beautiful. A must!

During a visit to Caesarea, we decided to try to Beigels of La Vita Bella. We ordered the Beigel with Smoked Salmon, cream cheese and salad inside. It was delicious and a very generous portion. We will certainly return when we are in the area.
We had the luck to arrive just when the changing of the guards started and this was really interesting. The horses are so lovely and well trained. Worth a visit.

We were at this hotel during an organised tour. We received an awful room with a smell of mould. The view from the window was a stone wall. Unfortunately we didnt complain as it was only for one night. That was a big mistake.

We came to the Scandic Kokstad on an organised tour. It is a lovely quality hotel but it is situated far from the centre of Bergen. We arrived late at night and tried to find somewhere to eat but there wasnt anything much in the area. It is very near to the airport which is suitable for some people.

We came with a group touring around Norway. The room was very ordinary and plain. The breakfast was very simple but we managed. However we found the evening meal very good and tasty which surprised us.
When you hear about this glacier, you expect something really special. However it is disappointing as over the years the glacier has melted so there isnt so much to see,

We came to the Stryn Hotel with an organised tour for one night. The rooms were very nice. Unfortunately the breakfast was very poor and most of the group were hungry. They told the person in charge who did not help.

Hotel 1904 is situated in the centre of Alesund Town. It is a very nice small hotel with good clean rooms. The breakfast was also varied with a good selection.The service in reception is good and they are very helpful.

We were there on our first day in Norway with a tour. I phoned a week earlier and requested a room on a high floor with a view. Howver I received the opposite, I went to the reception to complain and they werent interested. The hotel is nice and clean and very near to the airport.
